map

Class PathGeometryUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • map.PathGeometryUtils

  • public class PathGeometryUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class that allows calculation of PathElements, such as Coordinates X and Y, longest Line (PathLineSegment) or middle coordinates of a specific Line (PathLineSegment) within a Path. MapStreet class uses this utility methods to allow graphical representation of streets inside the Map

    • Method Detail

      • computeLineSegmentCoordinates

        public static double[] computeLineSegmentCoordinates(int index,
                                                     javafx.scene.shape.Path path)
        Calculates the start and end coordinates (X and Y) of a PathLineSegment. This method has been created in order to later retrieve the middle, length and rotation of the PathLineSegment
        Parameters:
        index - index of the PathElement
        path - path
        Returns:
        double[4] the start and end coordinates [startX, startY, endX, endY] of a PathLineSegment

      • computeLinetoCoordinates

        index - index of the LineTo PathElement

        public static double computeLineSegmentLength(double lineStartX,
                                              double lineStartY,
                                              double lineEndX,

        Calculates the length of a PathLineSegment based on its coordinates X and Y.
        Parameters:
        lineStartX - start X coordinates of the PathLineSegment
        lineStartY - start Y coordinates of the PathLineSegment
        lineEndX - end X coordinates of the PathLineSegment
        lineEndY - end Y coordinates of the PathLineSegment
        Returns:
        double the length in pixels of a PathLineSegment
